intro: Retiniphyllum pallidum, commonly known as the pale retiniphyllum, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its pale green, leathery leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in moist forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a delicate species with conservation concerns.
